GLMs, Nonlinearities and C-statistics 1.4 What is a C-static or its ilk for 1.4.1 Comparison to a saturated model Currently with how we use the c-statistic 1.4.2 Comparison to an alternate model New 1.4.3 Information theoretic approaches to model comparison Shipley paper MUST HAVE SAME VARIABLES Other ICs that might be better 1.5 How do we calculate information about missing links to integrate into a c-type statistic? 1.5.1 If relationships are symmetrical, i.e. linear, use current techniques 1.5.2 If relationships are assymetric, i.e. GLMs or other nonlinearities You can specificy directionality if you know it Do no present c-statistic unless user specifies directionality list of formulae to specify directions 1.5.3 If relationships are asymmetric and no known directionality Abandon SEM - you don’t know your model! Conservative hack: choose the lower p-value Distance based or other non-parametric correlation of residuals
